instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message: Boards turns on, charges, and recognizes the battery but wont run off the battery. Tried another dc in board and checked <RESISTOR>R6906</RESISTOR>, its good. Went to check <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> next but appears to be no stuff on this board. Compared to known good board and also appears to be no stuff. What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
You've got confused somehow.
The board cannot work on charger alone without <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR>.
But should work with charged battery in such case.
If board works on charger alone, but doesn't work on battery only, check <RESISTOR>R6906</RESISTOR>.
If is good, post all <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6990</CHIP>

 pin 1 1.258V

 pin 2 3.4V 

pin 3 7.14v  

pin 4 3.4V 

pin 6 18v

 pin 8 18v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message: Which case did you take these readings???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message: What do you mean? Just measured again and those readings are correct on the meter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
Measurements done with charger alone, battery alone, or both connected?
Board is turned on also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message: They were done with charger alone. Problem solved. <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> was faulty
